input: During the pandemic, US Foods identified an additional $180 million in permanent cost savings, which will enhance its legacy cost savings program of $150 million to $170 million in identified operating expense savings attributed to revamping the firm's supply chain, reducing indirect spending, leveraging shared services, and continuing to optimize the salesforce. This should offset expected wage and health care inflation, and investments in an expanded sales force and the firm's digital transformation, holding operating expense as a percentage of revenue at 14.5% over the long term, in line with 2019.
